titlestmt.titleproper: Preliminary Inventory to the Polish Arts and Culture Foundation records
Polish Arts and Culture Foundation records
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Nicholas Siekierski, Irena Czernichowska, and Vishnu Jani.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-11T15:48-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

change.item: 2012: sound recording and films description added; 2013: DVD access copy information added by Rachel and Vishnu

did.unittitle: Polish Arts and Culture Foundation records

physdesc.extent: 42 manuscript boxes, 13 cubic foot boxes, 2 audio cassettes boxes, 5 oversize boxes, 27 linear feet

did.abstract: Correspondence, writings, printed matter, photographs, sound recordings, video tapes, and motion picture film, relating to Polish culture and history, and to the Polish community in the United States. Includes material collected by the Foundation.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Polish Arts and Culture Foundation records, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 2001.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Note
bioghist.p: A private American organization for promotion of Polish culture, the Polish Arts and Culture Foundation (PACF) was established in 1966 when Poland celebrated her Christian Millennium. The Foundation's Silver Anniversary was celebrated in 1991, the year in which Poland realized the full restoration of the democratic government. PACF's mission is to educate the public about the historical, artistic, and cultural achievements of Poles and Polish Americans.

The Foundation has shared with Americans the wealth of Polish history and cultural achievements with presentations, publications, exhibits, concerts, and films. In keeping with its charter, the Foundation is a nonprofit, nonsectarian organization and engages only in nonpolitical activities.
Source: The Polish Arts and Culture Foundation website, http://www.polishculturesf.org/about/our-history/ Accessed November 5, 2012.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, writings, printed matter, photographs, sound recordings, video tapes, and motion picture film, relating to Polish culture and history, and to the Polish community in the United States. Includes material collected by the Foundation.
